cab.content:
Col. Dally Jones
(THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT).
SECRET.
G.T. 7744.
WAR CABINET
FOREIGN OPINION ON THE IRISH SITUATION.
Letter from British Military Representative, Supreme War Council to Secretary, War Cabinet, covering Extract from Page "C" of Annexure to "Radiotelegrammes Etrangers", dated 10th July 1919. Secretary,
War Cabinet,
PARIS.
I have the honour to bring to your notice an Extract from Page "C" of Annexure to "Radiotelegrammes Etrangers", dated 10th July, 1919, issued by the French War Office, a copy of which is attached. (Sgd)H.M. STUDD.
Brigadier-General,
Acting British Military Representative,
SUPREME WAR COUNCIL.
Extract from Pace "0" of ." Toutea los maisons en Irlande sont detruitea et pilleea par les soldats anrlais, Les femnes et les enfants sont terrorises. Les hov.ir.ies sont fusillea sans pretexts ou sur la moindre denonciation.X X X X X X.X X X
